---
layout: blog-post
title: Hands up...Don't shoot!!!
active: blog
background_color: DCEDC8
---

The movement [Hands up...Don't shoot!!!](https://www.facebook.com/events/426880870783172/?ref_newsfeed_story_type=regular&source=1) and the article ['When The Media Treats White Suspects And Killers Better Than Black Victims'](http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2014/08/14/media-black-victims_n_5673291.html) caught my attention on Facebook. All started from the brutal happening that an unarmed, black teenager, Michael Brown, in Ferguson, Missouri was shot by a police officer. Some of my friends are going to the rally called Birmingham Unity tomorrow at Kelly Ingram Park. As an international student, I'm just too timid to join the rally. Sorry!

I admit that I'm not so conscious of what happens in the world and feel shameful sometimes. Michael Brown's death definitely shouldn't happen again and I root for all trying to make it right out there, including my friend Chris. He got interviewed at a National Moment of Silence for a peaceful vigil in remembrance of Michael Brown. Here is a capture of the interview on [http://wiat.com/](http://up.anv.bz/latest/anvload.html?).
